H0.text: who were farmers who kept a small portion of their crops & gave the rest to the landowners. Tenant Farmers

H1.text: who were farmers who kept a small portion of their crops & gave the rest to the landowners. Serfs

H2.text: who were farmers who kept a small portion of their crops & gave the rest to the landowners. Peasants

H3.text: who were farmers who kept a small portion of their crops & gave the rest to the landowners. Sharecropping

A4.text: A sharecropper is a farm tenant who pays rent with a portion (often half) of the crop he raises and who brings little to the operation besides his family labor; the landlord usually furnishing working stock, tools, fertilizer, housing, fuel, and seed, and often providing regular advice and oversight.

A5.text: At harvest time, the tenants picked the cotton, and turned it all over to the landowners.
